action.action-desc: Mr. Emmer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Transportation to establish a national intersection and interchange safety construction program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Intersection and Interchange Safety Construction Program Act of 2021.

section.header: National Intersection and Interchange Safety Construction Program

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Transportation shall establish a national intersection and interchange safety construction program (in this section referred to as the Program) to assist safety improvements for high-risk intersections and interchanges.

paragraph.text: In carrying out the Program, the Secretary may make a grant to a covered entity in accordance with this section.
The Secretary shall award grants under the Program on a competitive basis.

subsection.text: The Secretary may only make a grant under the Program to assist a project that—

paragraph.text: is eligible for funding under title 23, United States Code; and
will improve the safety of an intersection or interchange that is—

subparagraph.text: used by an average of 50,000 vehicles a day; and
in immediate need of improvement with respect to safety.

subsection.text: To be eligible for a grant under the Program, a covered entity shall submit to the Secretary an application in such form, at such time, and containing such information as the Secretary determines is appropriate.

The aggregate amount provided to a covered entity in a fiscal year through grants under the Program may not exceed 5 percent of the amount made available for all grants under the Program in that fiscal year.

At least 90 days before establishing the Program under subsection (a), the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report detailing the selection process the Secretary shall use in making grants under the Program.
In this section, the term covered entity means each of the following:

paragraph.text: A territory of the United States.
Any entity composed of 2 or more entities described in paragraphs (1) through (5).
There is authorized to be appropriated out of the Highway Trust Fund (other than the Mass Transit Account) to carry out the Program $250,000,000 each fiscal year.

paragraph.header: Applicability of title 23, United States Code
paragraph.text: Funds authorized to be appropriated by paragraph (1) shall—

subparagraph.text: be available for obligation in the same manner as if those funds were apportioned under chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, except that the Federal share of the cost of a project or activity carried out using those funds shall be 80 percent; and
remain available until expended and not be transferable.
